column2: IDAHO DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: Idaho
column6: ID

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column6: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column10: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.

column2: 2. Pedestrians must yield to motor vehicles:
column4: when crossing the street in a marked crosswalk.
column6: when crossing the street where there is no crosswalk or intersection.
column10: when the motor vehicle is a large commercial vehicle.

column2: 3. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column6: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.
column8: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.

column2: 4. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column4: prevents distractions from other vehicles.
column6: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.
column10: gives you time to react to situations.

column2: 5. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column8: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.

column2: 6. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column6: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.

column2: 7. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: blue; white
column6: white; black

column2: 8. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
column6: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column8: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.

column2: 9. Drivers should allow a larger space cushion when stopping:
column4: at a stop sign.
column6: at a yield sign.

column2: 10. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column4: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.
column6: presence of a yield sign.
column8: number of cars in front of you.

column2: 11. Alcohol:
column4: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.
column6: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column10: enhances your ability to see clearly.

column2: 12. When worn, safety belts:
column4: help you maintain control of your car on rough roads.
column6: help you maintain control of your car on winding roads.
column8: reduce your chances of serious injury in an auto crash.

column2: 13. When the road is slippery, you should:
column4: pump your brakes.
column6: use your emergency or parking brake.
column8: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: Merging traffic
column6: Slippery when wet

column2: 15. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column4: no passing zone
column6: truck

column2: 16. Before changing lanes:
column4: signal at least 500 feet in advance on residential streets.
column6: begin signaling as you move into the next lane.
column10: check your blind spot only if you have an older vehicle without all of its mirrors.

column2: 17. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
column4: parking lights.
column6: high beam headlights.

column2: 18. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column10: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.

column2: 19. A flashing yellow traffic signal means:
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: No right turn.
column8: Stop and proceed when a green light appears.
column10: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.

column2: 20. To drive more safely at night:
column4: don’t drive when you are tired.
column6: increase following distance.
column8: make sure your headlights are working properly.

column2: 21. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column4: No one.
column6: The driver who does not control the car.

column2: 22. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: come to a complete stop.
column6: slow down and enter the intersection.
column10: enter the intersection and then stop.

column2: 23. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column6: look at your interior rear-view mirror.

column2: 24. This warning sign:
column4: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.
column6: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column8: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column10: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.

column2: 25. Bicyclists must:
column4: remain near the left edge of the road.
column6: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column8: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column10: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.

column2: 26. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column4: low beam headlights.
column6: emergency flashers.

column2: 27. When following other vehicles, maintain a space cushion of at least:
column4: two seconds.
column6: three seconds.

column2: 28. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Low ground clearance railroad crossing
column6: Train intersection

column2: 29. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column6: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.

column2: 30. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they cannot go straight ahead.
column6: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 31. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column6: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column8: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

column2: 32. When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, drivers should:
column4: enter slowly to avoid other vehicles.
column6: stop first, then gradually enter traffic.
column8: accelerate to the speed of traffic.
column10: drive above the speed of traffic to get ahead.

column2: 33. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
column6: watch for children and be ready to stop.
column8: always sound their horn and stay alert.
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 34. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column6: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column8: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
column10: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.

column2: 35. This sign means:
column4: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column6: Shopping centre ahead.
column8: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column10: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.

column2: 36. Which of the following is a common cause of a traffic collisions?
column4: Following too closely.
column6: Distracted driving.

column2: 37. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Stop.
column6: Maintenance warning.

column2: 38. Tailgating:
column4: cannot result in a traffic citation.
column6: helps reduce traffic congestion.
column8: can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.

column2: 39. This road sign means:
column4: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left
column6: A road joins from the left

column2: 40. This road sign means:
column4: Keep right
column6: Side road
